projects.description: A random quote generator, pulling from an array of objects. Background color randomly changes for every quote, and quote automatically changes every 20 seconds unless it's manually changed by the user.
A list of students is automatically paginated to show 10 per page. Page buttons are automatically appended based on the number of pages, and a search filter allows users to search for students.

A form with validation and various conditions for multiple fields. Includes regexp validation and other methods. Certain options are toggled on or off, depending on what other options are selected. Price is automatically calculated based on selected preferences, and users can't select more than one event with the same date/time

A word guessing game, similar to Wheel of Fortune. Random idioms are appended to the screen from an array a the beginning of the game.  Letters can be selected via the user's keyboard, or the onscreen keyboard. Every letter correctly guessed is displayed on the screen, and the selected key is disabled. Selecting a letter not in the word removes 1 of your 5 lives. Incorrectly selected letters are colored uniquely.

projects.project_name: Fetching, parsing, styling, and rendering JSON data.
projects.description: A JSON feed containing data on random students is fetched, parsed, and styled onto the page.  Clicking each students fetches more information on that student (querying the JSON feed for the additional information), and "Previous/Next" buttons allow you to cycle through other student modals in order.  There's a search bar to narrow down the list of students.

projects.project_name: React-based app for searching through Flickr image tags
projects.description: A React-based app that allows you to search Flickr's public api for tags, or allows you to filter through 3 presets. The image urls are dynamically constructed based on either the search query, or the URL parameters.

projects.project_name: Nodejs, Express, and Sequelize for book database
projects.description: An app using Nodejs, Express, and Sequelize to create a book database.  Database allows users to modify and enter their own books, and well as search current books.  The user also has the option to enable pagination, or view the entire list.

projects.project_name: Full Stack App with React and a REST API
projects.description: A React App allowing users to view, edit, and publish course materials. Users can sign up and login to create their own courses, or edit and delete their existing courses. Only the course creator may edit or delete their own course. User and course info is returned from REST API which I created (API, GitHub). The API uses basic-auth for authentication, and stores/returns information in a Sequelize managed database.
A React App allowing users to search the OpenTable API for restaurants by City.  Results are paginated, with next/prev buttons allowing users to cycle through the pages.

projects.project_name: Full Stack React App - Dating Site
projects.description: A React App allowing users to sign up for a dating site, then matches are pulled based on their profile information.  Users create an account, then create a profile. When logged in, they are able to view and update their profile, and view their matches.  Information is returned from a REST API created with Node.js, Express, SQLite and Sequelize.
